item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

My advice would be to look at the multiple NIO tutorials online, most of which come with examples, and then write up a simple server like HTTP to get the hang of it before moving onto harder things.

Read full topic

item.title: Nio
item.dc:creator: @xpatx xpatx
item.description:
@xpatx wrote:

Well, I am wanting to learn standard NIO. I understand basically the NIO standard pattern, but I don’t understand how to actually create a connection that read/writes/accepts. I have the read/write interface that I can support. Can someone actually write up the class that will read/write/accept the connection?

EDIT: I know the writer/reader aren’t complete since the actual Channel hasn’t been created.

[code=java]import java.io.IOException;
import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
import java.nio.channels.SocketChannel;

public interface ReadableByteChannel {

public int read(ByteBuffer b, SocketChannel socketChannel) throws IOException;

}[/code]

[code=java]import java.io.IOException;
import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
import java.nio.channels.SocketChannel;

public interface WritableByteChannel {

public int write(ByteBuffer b, SocketChannel socketChannel) throws IOException;

}[/code]

Read full topic
